Package de.plasticghoul.vudials

Class MCVUDialsHelper

java.lang.Object
de.plasticghoul.vudials.MCVUDialsHelper
public class MCVUDialsHelper extends Object
Main class that manages all variables (get and set)

  • Method Details

    • isVUServerListening

      public static boolean isVUServerListening(String host, int port)
      This method tests if the VU Server is listening on the configured hostname and port.
      Parameters:
      host - The hostname of the VU Server
      port - The port on which the VU Server should listen
      Returns:
      True if the server listens on the given hostname and port

    • isVUServerAnswering

      public static boolean isVUServerAnswering(String apiBaseUrl, String apiKey)
      This method tests if the VU Server is answering to HTTP requests.
      Parameters:
      apiBaseUrl - The base URL of the api server
      apiKey - The API key which is needed in order to make requests against the API
      Returns:
      True if the server answers on the given base url

    • isVUServerAvailable

      public static boolean isVUServerAvailable()
      This method tests if the VU Server is listening and answering by calling isVUServerListening() and isVUServerAnswering().
      Returns:
      True if the server listens and answers

    • getDialUids

      public static void getDialUids()
      This method is getting a list of dial UIDs so it can be used later on.

    • getCurrentHealthValuePercent

      public static int getCurrentHealthValuePercent()
      This method gets the currently set health value.
      Returns:
      The current health value as an integer

    • setCurrentHealthValuePercent

      public static void setCurrentHealthValuePercent(float newHealth, float maxHealth)
      This method calculates the new health value and saves it in a variable.
      Parameters:
      newHealth - The new health value to be set (before percentage calculation)
      maxHealth - The maximum possible health value

    • getCurrentFoodLevelValuePercent

      Returns:
      The current food level value as an integer

      This method calculates the new food level value and saves it in a variable.
      Parameters:
      newFoodLevel - The new food level value to be set (before percentage calculation)
      maxFoodLevel - The maximum possible food level value

    • getCurrentHealthColors

      public static HashMap<String,Integer> getCurrentHealthColors()
      This method gets the currently set health colors.
      Returns:
      The current health colors as a HashMap

    • getNewHealthColors

      public static HashMap<String,Integer> getNewHealthColors(int newHealth)
      This method calculates the new health color based on the given health value and saves it in a HashMap. This is needed to later compare the new and the current colors in order to reduce API calls.
      Parameters:
      newHealth - The new health value to be set (before percentage calculation)
      Returns:
      Returns a HashMap with possible new color values for comparison with the current set color values

    • setCurrentHealthColors

      public static void setCurrentHealthColors()
      This method calculates the current health color based on the given health value and saves it in a HashMap.

    • getCurrentFoodLevelColors

      public static HashMap<String,Integer> getCurrentFoodLevelColors()
      This method gets the currently set food level colors.
      Returns:
      The current food level colors as a HashMap

    • getNewFoodLevelColors

      public static HashMap<String,Integer> getNewFoodLevelColors(int newFoodLevel)
      This method calculates the new food level color based on the given food level value and saves it in a HashMap. This is needed to later compare the new and the current colors in order to reduce API calls.
      Parameters:
      newFoodLevel - The new food level value to be set (before percentage calculation)
      Returns:
      Returns a HashMap with possible new color values for comparison with the current set color values

    • setCurrentFoodLevelColors

      public static void setCurrentFoodLevelColors()
      This method calculates the current food level color based on the currently set food level value and saves it in a HashMap.
